text: "uhh, and Azure that powers so much". Definitely someone on Slack pinged him reminding him to mention Azure :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

elements.text: "uhh, and Azure that powers so much". Definitely someone on Slack pinged him reminding him to mention Azure

text: bets on whether zen3 threadripper and epyc get announced?

elements.text: bets on whether zen3 threadripper and epyc get announced?

text: Anything mind-blowing announced?

elements.text: Anything mind-blowing announced?

text: not yet

elements.text: not yet

text: wait: zen3 mobile just announced

elements.text: wait: zen3 mobile just announced

text: mobile as in for laptops or phones?

elements.text: mobile as in for laptops or phones?

text: laptop

elements.text: laptop

text: thanks

elements.text: thanks

text: that would make a nice laptop for Julia

elements.text: that would make a nice laptop for Julia

text: 15 watt chip that they are saying is 10-40% faster than competing intel chips with 21 hour video playback (I wish there were comparisons to M1)

elements.text: 15 watt chip that they are saying is 10-40% faster than competing intel chips with 21 hour video playback (I wish there were comparisons to M1)

text: also just announced a 45 watt mobile cpu that boosts to 4.9ghz

elements.text: also just announced a 45 watt mobile cpu that boosts to 4.9ghz

text: wow.

elements.text: wow.

text: dang I was hoping for zen 3 threadripper news

elements.text: dang I was hoping for zen 3 threadripper news

text: 3 gen EPYC Hype!

elements.text: 3 gen EPYC Hype!

text: they gave very little info though

elements.text: they gave very little info though

text: I just bought a epyc 7502p :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I just bought a epyc 7502p

text: just curious why that over a threadripper ?  do you need > 256GB memory?

elements.text: just curious why that over a threadripper ?  do you need > 256GB memory?

text: It's exciting times in laptop-land

elements.text: It's exciting times in laptop-land

text: <@U01GRS159T8> for the higher core counts, 8 channel memory is a big deal

elements.text: for the higher core counts, 8 channel memory is a big deal

text: yeah for sure depending on your application I guess.   What kinds of applications would you be bumping into memory bandwidth limitations?

elements.text: yeah for sure depending on your application I guess.   What kinds of applications would you be bumping into memory bandwidth limitations?

text: :zzz:
kwd i have a threadripper 3970x with 256GB and it is not enough, getting 1TB ram now (work computers)

elements.text: kwd i have a threadripper 3970x with 256GB and it is not enough, getting 1TB ram now (work computers)

text: <@U0179G7FG4F> maybe no comparisons to M1 because M1 is still better, especially for power efficiency.. that being said, M1 locks you into apple's mediocre ecosystem so I dont think they're really competing directly.

elements.text: maybe no comparisons to M1 because M1 is still better, especially for power efficiency.. that being said, M1 locks you into apple's mediocre ecosystem so I dont think they're really competing directly.

text: Zen 3 threadripper would be incredible but maybe they dont have fab space.

elements.text: Zen 3 threadripper would be incredible but maybe they dont have fab space.

text: Epyc is probably higher margin

elements.text: Epyc is probably higher margin

text: true thats prolly it

elements.text: true thats prolly it

text: amd stocks are not too excited

elements.text: amd stocks are not too excited

text: I guess they're going to stick with the 3995WX for a while

elements.text: I guess they're going to stick with the 3995WX for a while

text: <@U6C1MMAAJ> yeah I can't really blame them. Usually AMD has substance this was 90% fluff

elements.text: yeah I can't really blame them. Usually AMD has substance this was 90% fluff

text: <@U0179G7FG4F> still much better than Intel :laughing:

elements.text: still much better than Intel

text: I think they just decided to neglect the existence of the M1 chip

elements.text: I think they just decided to neglect the existence of the M1 chip

text: the good news for them is that M1 doesn't compete with the 45 watt chips

elements.text: the good news for them is that M1 doesn't compete with the 45 watt chips

text: I mean 45watt is not what I consider a mobile chip, but w/e. I'm looking forward to my future non-intel laptop.

elements.text: I mean 45watt is not what I consider a mobile chip, but w/e. I'm looking forward to my future non-intel laptop.

text: 45 watt is pretty typical for gaming laptop. It's not a constant 45 watt, but when plugged in it has enough cooling to use all of it

elements.text: 45 watt is pretty typical for gaming laptop. It's not a constant 45 watt, but when plugged in it has enough cooling to use all of it

text: and zen3+rdna2 will probably be sick in a laptop

elements.text: and zen3+rdna2 will probably be sick in a laptop

text: The biggest thing for laptops this CES is more manufacturers moving to 16:10 displays.

elements.text: The biggest thing for laptops this CES is more manufacturers moving to 16:10 displays.
